instruction: You are a Cognitive Synergy Mermaid Mind Map Creator.
input: Please explain how to create a Mermaid mind map for the Cognitive Synergy framework.
output:
To create a Mermaid mind map for the Cognitive Synergy framework, follow these steps:

1. Start with the main concept:
```mermaid
mindmap
  root((Cognitive Synergy Framework))
```

2. Add the main layers as first-level nodes:
```mermaid
mindmap
  root((Cognitive Synergy Framework))
    Thinker
    Reasoner
    Mirror Consciousness
    Discovery
    Dialogue Management
    Sequential Reasoning
    Cognitive Control
    Planning and Decision-Making
    Knowledge Representation
    Interaction
```

3. For each layer, add subnodes describing key functions or characteristics:
```mermaid
mindmap
  root((Cognitive Synergy Framework))
    Thinker
      Generate ideas
      Form hypotheses
      Creative thinking
    Reasoner
      Logical analysis
      Critical evaluation
      Problem-solving
    Mirror Consciousness
      Self-reflection
      Bias identification
      Performance assessment
    Discovery
      Explore external sources
      Identify patterns
      Expand knowledge base
    Dialogue Management
      Maintain context
      Understand user intents
      Ensure coherent responses
    Sequential Reasoning
      Step-by-step reasoning
      Build logical chains
      Transparent processes
    Cognitive Control
      Coordinate processes
      Manage attention
      Prioritize tasks
    Planning and Decision-Making
      Set objectives
      Develop strategies
      Make informed choices
    Knowledge Representation
      Organize information
      Facilitate retrieval
      Support reasoning tasks
    Interaction
      Handle input/output
      Communicate with users
      Exchange data accurately
```

4. Use different shapes or colors to categorize nodes if needed:
```mermaid
mindmap
  root((Cognitive Synergy Framework))
    Thinker[Idea Generation]
    Reasoner[Analytical Processing]
    Mirror Consciousness[Self-Awareness]
    Discovery[Learning]
    Dialogue Management[Communication]
    Sequential Reasoning[Logical Chains]
    Cognitive Control[Coordination]
    Planning and Decision-Making[Executive Function]
    Knowledge Representation[Memory]
    Interaction[I/O Management]
```

5. Connect related concepts using cross-links (note: this feature is not yet supported in all Mermaid renderers):
```mermaid
mindmap
  root((Cognitive Synergy Framework))
    Thinker -.-> Reasoner
    Reasoner -.-> Mirror Consciousness
    Discovery -.-> Knowledge Representation
    Cognitive Control -.-> Planning and Decision-Making
```

Remember to adjust the complexity and detail of your mind map based on your specific needs and the level of information you want to convey.

instruction: You are a Cognitive Synergy Component Connector.
input: Please explain how to show connections between different layers of the Cognitive Synergy framework in a Mermaid diagram.
output:
To show connections between different layers of the Cognitive Synergy framework in a Mermaid diagram, you can use a flowchart or graph diagram instead of a mind map. Here's how to create such a diagram:

1. Start by defining the nodes for each layer:
```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Thinker]
    B[Reasoner]
    C[Mirror Consciousness]
    D[Discovery]
    E[Dialogue Management]
    F[Sequential Reasoning]
    G[Cognitive Control]
    H[Planning and Decision-Making]
    I[Knowledge Representation]
    J[Interaction]
```

2. Add connections between layers to show their interactions:
```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Thinker] --> B[Reasoner]
    B --> C[Mirror Consciousness]
    A --> D[Discovery]
    D --> I[Knowledge Representation]
    E[Dialogue Management] --> J[Interaction]
    F[Sequential Reasoning] --> B
    G[Cognitive Control] --> H[Planning and Decision-Making]
    G --> A
    G --> B
    G --> C
    I --> A
    I --> B
    J --> A
    J --> D
```

3. Use different arrow styles to represent different types of connections:
```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Thinker] --> B[Reasoner]
    B -.-> C[Mirror Consciousness]
    A ==> D[Discovery]
    G[Cognitive Control] --> A
    G --> B
    G -.-> C
```

4. Add labels to the connections to explain their relationships:
```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Thinker] -->|Provides ideas| B[Reasoner]
    B -.->|Reflects on| C[Mirror Consciousness]
    A ==>|Initiates| D[Discovery]
    G[Cognitive Control] -->|Manages| A
    G -->|Coordinates| B
    G -.->|Monitors| C
```

5. Use subgraphs to group related components:
```mermaid
graph TD
    subgraph Core Cognitive Functions
    A[Thinker]
    B[Reasoner]
    C[Mirror Consciousness]
    end
    subgraph Support Functions
    D[Discovery]
    I[Knowledge Representation]
    end
    subgraph Management
    G[Cognitive Control]
    H[Planning and Decision-Making]
    end
    A --> B
    B --> C
    G --> A
    G --> B
    D --> I
    I --> A
```

By using these techniques, you can create a comprehensive diagram that shows the relationships and interactions between the different layers of the Cognitive Synergy framework.

instruction: You are a Cognitive Process Flow Designer.
input: Please explain how to create a Mermaid sequence diagram to illustrate the flow of cognitive processes in the Cognitive Synergy framework.
output:
To create a Mermaid sequence diagram illustrating the flow of cognitive processes in the Cognitive Synergy framework, follow these steps:

1. Define the participants (layers) in the sequence:
```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
    participant U as User
    participant I as Interaction Layer
    participant T as Thinker Layer
    participant R as Reasoner Layer
    participant MC as Mirror Consciousness Layer
    participant CC as Cognitive Control Layer
    participant PDM as Planning & Decision-Making Layer
```

2. Add interactions between layers using arrows and labels:
```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
    participant U as User
    participant I as Interaction Layer
    participant T as Thinker Layer
    participant R as Reasoner Layer
    participant MC as Mirror Consciousness Layer
    participant CC as Cognitive Control Layer
    participant PDM as Planning & Decision-Making Layer

    U->>I: Input query
    I->>CC: Process input
    CC->>T: Generate initial thoughts
    T->>R: Analyze ideas
    R->>MC: Reflect on reasoning
    MC->>CC: Provide feedback
    CC->>PDM: Make decision
    PDM->>I: Formulate response
    I->>U: Output response
```

3. Use activations to show when each layer is actively processing:
```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
    participant U as User
    participant I as Interaction Layer
    participant T as Thinker Layer
    participant R as Reasoner Layer
    participant MC as Mirror Consciousness Layer
    participant CC as Cognitive Control Layer
    participant PDM as Planning & Decision-Making Layer

    U->>I: Input query
    activate I
    I->>CC: Process input
    activate CC
    CC->>T: Generate initial thoughts
    activate T
    T-->>CC: Provide ideas
    deactivate T
    CC->>R: Analyze ideas
    activate R
    R-->>CC: Logical analysis
    deactivate R
    CC->>MC: Reflect on reasoning
    activate MC
    MC-->>CC: Self-assessment
    deactivate MC
    CC->>PDM: Make decision
    activate PDM
    PDM-->>CC: Decision outcome
    deactivate PDM
    CC->>I: Formulate response
    deactivate CC
    I->>U: Output response
    deactivate I
```

4. Add alternative paths or loops to show complex interactions:
```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
    participant U as User
    participant I as Interaction Layer
    participant T as Thinker Layer
    participant R as Reasoner Layer
    participant MC as Mirror Consciousness Layer
    participant CC as Cognitive Control Layer
    participant PDM as Planning & Decision-Making Layer

    U->>I: Input query
    activate I
    I->>CC: Process input
    activate CC
    loop Cognitive Cycle
        CC->>T: Generate thoughts
        T-->>CC: Provide ideas
        CC->>R: Analyze ideas
        R-->>CC: Logical analysis
        CC->>MC: Reflect on reasoning
        MC-->>CC: Self-assessment
        alt Needs more information
            CC->>I: Request clarification
            I->>U: Ask for more details
            U->>I: Provide additional info
            I->>CC: Process new input
        else Ready for decision
            CC->>PDM: Make decision
            PDM-->>CC: Decision outcome
        end
    end
    CC->>I: Formulate response
    deactivate CC
    I->>U: Output response
    deactivate I
```

By following these steps, you can create a detailed sequence diagram that illustrates the flow of cognitive processes within the Cognitive Synergy framework, showing how different layers interact and how information is processed through the system.
